channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MA

item.title: Report X-2024040354
item.description:
Report X-2024040354

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-16T18:13:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-29
  • City: BROCKTON
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg was unloaded from hub trailer 828312 with wet cardboard from internal leakage. Improperly braced in trailer. Manager alerted and pkg brought to QA in red HAZMAT bucket. DescribePack: 1 1USGAL bottle with a broken cap resulting in spilled contents. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pkg was placed upright in a red HAZMAT bin and brought to QA.

item.title: Report E-2024040207
item.description:
Report E-2024040207

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-11T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-09
  • City: NORTHBOROUGH
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While loading freight into trailer, forkblades of the forklift the forklift operator was using were stick out from the pallet that was being loaded into the trailer. Consequently, the forkblades struck two drums that were already staged in the trailer puncturing them contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as were the two punctured drums.
